intro: Medicago agrestis, commonly known as the goat's rue or wild medic, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features trifoliate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters. Medicago agrestis is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is adapted to a wide range of environmental conditions. Its ability to fix nitrogen makes it an important plant in soil enrichment and ecological restoration efforts.
